availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Yantis (Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Yantis. Father of Maggie Yantis. Merchant in Garrard County in 1863. Musician in the First Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from October 1861 to March 1862.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 24-25; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 7; Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0013; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Garrard County, KY, June/July 1863, p. 404, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
